# Spelljammer Campaign History for SPAR Import

“Waking the Guardians Spiral” is listed under Future Sessions

## Canon Summary

### Premise
A Spelljammer 5e campaign with a “Treasure Planet meets Planescape meets Radiant Horror” vibe
The core myth-arc is time, memory, and who gets to decide what history “should” be, centered on the Chronolens and the secret order called the Temporal Guardians

### Player Characters
- Albanus (giff monk)
- Amolara (human artificer “witch”)
- Bryannas (elf arcane archer)
- Eisira (male eladrin monk), secretly runs a criminal organization based out of the Radiant Citadel
- Garabi (thri-kreen rogue), on a prophecy quest for a crystal egg
- Lucky (plasmoid warlock)
- Magnus (fighter), later revealed as an infiltrator/traitor aligned with the Solstice Pact
- Tig (kender monk), currently petrified
- Zefot (kalashtar monk), displaced from Eberron, unknowingly time-flung ~20,000 years forward

### Key NPCs / Powers in Play
- Biziver (autognome cleric, Twilight/Celestian), linked to the Temporal Guardians, later captured in the betrayal at the Citadel
- Khalir of the Pale Path (Moonstone Incarnate) and Sylemeth (Amethyst Incarnate), prophetic/vision catalysts
- Zash’ir (Githyanki swordsage, temporal affinity), an “oracle-witness” figure tied to Maker vaults and the Infinite Staircase
- The Solstice Pact (Astral Elf splinter faction) seeking “temporal reclamation,” using infiltration and chronomancy, with Magnus as an agent
- The Makers (a Phirblas offshoot, conceptual glyph-architects) whose hidden systems under/within the Citadel run on intent-driven glyph logic

### Major Artifacts and Mysteries
- The Chronolens: a powerful temporal vision/observation device; stolen by Magnus + Solstice Pact during the Citadel betrayal
- Bryannas’s Ring: allows a 1-minute rewind at the cost of 10 years of aging, and ties her to Guardian legacy
- Infernal Device of Lum the Mad (control lever): in Bryannas’s possession (true function still unrevealed in-play)
- Star Seeds / Incarnates / Radiant Citadel origin: Star Seed activations can birth Incarnates and reshape worlds, and the Citadel is “the one that remembered”

### Cosmology Backbone (Myth-Arc Compression)
- The Spellplague era is treated as a major chronal divergence that helped create “First Watchers,” chronally contaminated modrons that eventually become the Temporal Guardians
- The Temporal Guardians are framed as awakened modrons with time-harmonic capabilities, operating out of Fortress Epoch (partially out of phase with standard reality)
- The Solstice Pact believes their timeline was pruned or stolen during a Star Seed event, driving their “reclamation war”
- Eberron is long-destroyed; anyone traveling there now would find a desert wasteland suitable for Dark Sun–style adventures (Athas tone)

### Current Situation
- The party opened a doorway to the Infinite Staircase (as it began to close) at the same moment a massive warforged city-ship appeared over the Radiant Citadel
- Immediately after, play shifted to an Athas one-shot (Session 10), set in the desert-wasteland era tied to Eberron’s fate

---

## Campaign Ledger (Sessionized History)

### 2025-01-05 — Session 0 — Radiant Citadel: Formation and Omens
- The PCs meet on/around the Radiant Citadel
- Zefot is singled out by the Amethyst Incarnate and receives the “branching life-path” boon (visions of diverging futures)

### 2025-01-19 — Session 1 — The Blight Job → Fistandia’s Mansion
- The party investigates a world/region suffering an accelerating blight
- Research leads them through a portal into Fistandia’s extradimensional mansion, then onward toward Toril-based clues about ancient curses

### 2025-02-02 — Session 2 — Toril: Northern Pilgrimage and the Auril Trap
- The party travels with pilgrims into the northern wastes, led by Yselm Bloodfang (secretly aligned with Auril)
- They find Fistandia trapped in a cave by a curse-work/time-dilation survival device

### 2025-02-16 — Session 3 — Toril: Battle in the Null-Time Cave, Tig Petrified
- Yselm reveals her agenda, attacks with powerful allies
- During/after the fight, a party member is poisoned; Fistandia sacrifices her containment device, fully embraces her curse, petrifies the dying PC to stabilize them, then flees into the world (Tig remains petrified)

### 2025-03-02 — Session 4 — Rock of Bral: Ground Crew and the Rogue Comet
- The party lands at The Laughing Beholder on the Rock of Bral, finds work with a salvage company
- They pursue a rogue comet fragment containing giant-sized ruins matching Eberron giant motifs
- They breach a concentric time-slow trap and recover a key Chronolens component (via Bryannas’s ring resonance)

### 2025-03-16 — Session 5 — Radiant Citadel: Biziver, the Guardians, and the Lambent Zenith
- The party meets Biziver, who reveals he helped orchestrate the party’s convergence and confirms Bryannas’s father’s link to the Temporal Guardians
- Mission: find the missing ship Lambent Zenith, last known to be transporting a critical Chronolens-related piece

### 2025-03-30 — Session 6 — The Uncharted Sphere: Ilevathos and the Shipwreck Maelstrom
- The party finds a small crystal sphere: a wreckage-maelstrom circling the dead god Ilevathos, the Whispering Reliquary
- They crash onto the god-corpse, find the Lambent Zenith split into three sections, rescue survivors suffering temporal malaise
- A disguised Death Slaad is exposed and defeated (with help from an ally revealed to be a Couatl), though much of the crew dies

### 2025-04-13 — Session 7 — Return to the Citadel: Plans, Then the Betrayal
- Biziver explains the Guardians have closed normal access routes; the Infinite Staircase may be the only path
- Magnus betrays the party: stabs Biziver as a signal, Astral Elves attack, higher ranks escape via teleport stones with Biziver, the Chronolens, and many notes
- The bastion burns; the party recovers Biziver’s message bottle, sends a warning, and finds damaged notes referencing “the Makers” and a mason’s mark seen around the Citadel

### 2025-04-27 — Session 8 — Echoes of the Makers, Part 1: Incarnates and the Archives
- The party meets Khalir (Moonstone Incarnate) and Sylemeth (Amethyst Incarnate)
- At the Archives of Reflection, PCs experience personalized vision sequences and gain glyph resonances
- They learn the Makers are likely a Phirblas offshoot, and Maker glyphs encode concepts, not letters

### 2025-05-11 — Session 9 — Echoes of the Makers, Part 2: Maker Tunnels and the Gate
- A basement collapse reveals hidden access into Maker tunnels beneath Eisira’s HQ
- The party navigates intent-driven, glyph-activated catacombs toward the mechanism chamber
- Zash’ir activates the mechanism (using a 1,000 gp fire opal), ejecting an existing Star Seed and birthing/launching a new Star Seed
- A doorway to the Infinite Staircase appears and begins to close
- A massive warforged city-ship appears over the Radiant Citadel, casting the city into shadow

### 2025-05-25 — Session 10 (Current) — Athas One-Shot: The Glass Spires and the Buried Colossus
This session is a side-story in the Dark Sun–toned desert wasteland (Athas feel), tied to the campaign’s Eberron-into-wasteland revelation

The party plays as a four-character one-shot team (separate cast from the main Spelljammer crew)
- Location focus: the Glass Spires and a partially exposed, ancient colossus structure
- Key pressure mechanics in play:
  - Warden Attention clock (how close the region’s “Warden” is to detecting/engaging the team)
  - Colossus Intel clock (how much actionable understanding the team extracts before the situation collapses)
- Major encounter anchor: the Cinderstalker Pack in the Glass Spires
- Tone/structure: exploration-first, escalating pursuit, ending in a planned TPK; any treasure is only relevant inside this one-shot

---

## Future Sessions

### Future Session — Waking the Guardians Spiral (Projected Session 11)
- Macro-objective: ascend the Infinite Staircase to reach the Temporal Guardians before the Solstice Pact
- Expected play: paradox realms, time fractures, and “what counts as canon” dilemmas as the party tries to recover the Chronolens and rescue Biziver

---

## Open Threads and “Next Imports” Hooks
- Recover the Chronolens from the Solstice Pact; determine what they’ve learned/changed with it
- Rescue Biziver, and recover any stolen notes that decode Makers / Guardians access routes
- First contact with the warforged city-ship: intent, threat vs refuge, and its tie to Zefot/Eberron’s lost timeline
- Zefot’s displacement (Eberron → Radiant Citadel + 20,000 years) and who “touched” that portal
- Bryannas’s ring (rewind/age) and how many “ten-year minutes” she’ll spend before it breaks her
- Eisira’s gang as an ongoing power base on the Citadel, destabilized by the bastion fire and new existential threats
- Star Seed cycle implications: opening a Staircase door appears to have world-scale consequences
